newsitem.title: USA: Spyglass up on in-line EPS, license deals.
newsitem.headline: Spyglass up on in-line EPS, license deals.

text.p: Spyglass Inc shares rose more than 26 percent Wednesday after the company reported earnings in line with expectations and cited software licensing deals with key companies, analysts said.

"There have been a lot of disappointments this quarter" with companies not meeting expectations, said Dawn Simon, Advest Inc's vice president of software research. "I think they're being rewarded for being up front and executing well."

Spyglass reported fiscal second quarter earnings of $0.16 a share including a one-time payment from Microsoft Corp and a one-time charge of about $900,000 a share for closing its Champaign, Ill., office. Last year, the company posted a $0.06 a share net profit.
According to First Call, the consensus estimate was $0.20 a share excluding the charge -- pegged by analysts at $0.04 a share -- but including the payment.
"The fear that they might miss the quarter is gone," Nesbitt Burns analyst Abi Gami said.

Gami said Spyglass's deal with International Business Machines Corp was also positive for the company, which last year announced a strategy to create software and services to link non-personal computer devices to the Internet. Spyglass also has a key deal with Xerox Corp.
Spyglass said IBM licensed its Device Mosaic software for the IBM Network Station, its network computer which began shipping this week.
"That's more visibility, and that's what investors were wanting," Gami said.
Shares of Spyglass traded 1-5/8 higher at 7-3/4.
